1.title: America and Israel Confront the Iran Threat
1.plot: As the Iranian regime is rocked by protests, Pastor Matt Hagee joins us to talk about the need for moral clarity in supporting Israel and facing down evil. Plus, a Palestinian Muslim turns from Israel hater to pro-Israel advocate. We also pay a visit to Ein Karem, the birthplace of John the Baptist.

2.title: Up Close Look at Hamas Threat, from Israel-Gaza Border
2.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Nahal Oz, on Israel's border with Gaza, for an up-close look at the Hamas terror threat and how the IDF is fighting back against terror tunnels.

3.title: How the Israel Defense Forces are Preparing for the Next War
3.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is on Israel's Golan Heights, near the Syrian border. He joins an elite paratrooper unit of the Israel Defense Forces for a live fire drill to prepare for security threats on Israel's borders.

4.title: Holding Terrorists and Rogue Regimes Accountable
4.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to interview attorney Nitsana Darshan-Leitner about her fight to bring terrorists to justice. Plus, Sandra Hagee Parker discusses CUFI's efforts for Israel in Washington, D.C. We also pay a visit to Gaza border to discuss ISIS and Iranian influence there.

5.title: Stunning New Western Wall Excavation Reveals Roman Theatre
5.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck visits Jerusalem's Western Wall tunnels and a new excavation of an ancient Roman theatre. Plus, the story of King David's prayer altar, from the City of David.

6.title: Why Iran is Determined to Have a Foothold in Syria
6.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to interview Israeli journalist Jonathan Spyer about Iran's moves inside Syria and why Israel must stop Iran's plans. Plus, a new film called "Faithkeepers" takes a closer look at Christian persecution in the Middle East.

7.title: The Coming U.S. Embassy Move to Jerusalem
7.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck interviews CUFI Founder and Chairman, Pastor John Hagee, in Washington, D.C. about the importance of the U.S. Embassy's coming move to Jerusalem and what it means for the Middle East and for America.

8.title: Exploring Shiloh, Site of Israel's Ancient Tabernacle
8.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Israel's Samaria region to explore the ancient ruins of Shiloh, where the Tabernacle and Ark of the Covenant were once located. Plus, a very special stop on the amazing Israel Trail.

9.title: Iran's Growing Empire and How Israel is Fighting Back
9.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Tel Aviv to interview Israel Defense Forces spokesman Lt. Col. Jonathan Conricus on how the IDF is preparing for threats on Israel's borders. Plus, a hard-hitting national security panel breaks down the issues from Jerusalem.

10.title: How Israel Not Only Survives, But Thrives
10.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem with Ambassador Yoram Ettinger and Middle East correspondent Chris Mitchell to discuss the latest news from the Middle East and how Israel is not only surviving, but thriving.

11.title: The Unbreakable U.S./Israel Alliance, Part 1
11.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Washington, D.C. to interview Senator Lindsey Graham about growing national security threats and how America and Israel should respond. Plus, a group of NFL players has a life-changing visit to the Holy Land.

12.title: The Unbreakable U.S./Israel Alliance, Part 2
12.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Washington, D.C. to interview Senator James Lankord about the strengthening alliance between the U.S. and Israel. Plus, author Avi Jorisch discusses amazing Israeli innovation and how they are blessing the world.

13.title: Israel Turns 70; The Story Behind a Modern Miracle
13.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Tel Aviv at Israel's Independence Hall to recount the events leading up to the nation of Israel's miraculous rebirth 70 years ago on May 14th, 1948.

14.title: How Israel's Elite Palmach Unit Helped Win 1948 War for Independence
14.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is at Tel Aviv's Palmach Museum to interview a veteran of Israel's legendary Palmach unit, who describes the challenges of Israel's 1948 War for Independence. Plus, how the world's only one-armed sharpshooter continues to serve in the Israeli Defense Forces and inspire the world.

15.title: Inside the Opening of the U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem
15.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to cover the historic opening of the U.S. Embassy with Ambassador David Friedman, Pastor John Hagee, and Governor Mike Huckabee.

16.title: Israel and Iran Collide on Golan Heights
16.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem with the leadership of Christians United for Israel to discuss the strong U.S/Israel alliance and the upcoming CUFI Washington Summit.

17.title: After Jerusalem Embassy Move, What Comes Next?
17.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem with the leadership of Christians United for Israel to discuss the strong U.S/Israel alliance and the upcoming CUFI Washington Summit.

18.title: Inside the New Museum of the Bible in Washington, D.C.
18.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Washington, D.C. to see the amazing history and artifacts displayed at the new Museum of the Bible.

19.title: Join the Annual Jersualem Day Celebration
19.plot: As Israel marks its 70th anniversary, host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to capture the sights and sounds of the annual "Jerusalem Day" celebration.

20.title: Israel: A Beacon of Freedom in Chaotic Middle East
20.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to interview Ambassador Dore Gold about the Iranian regime's war on the United States. Plus, an update on an American Christian pastor imprisoned in Turkey.

21.title: Two Israeli Terror Victims Share Their Incredible Stories of Survival
21.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem with two brave Israeli survivors of terrorism who share their harrowing but inspiring stories.

22.title: Discovering the Land of Jordan's Incredible Biblical Heritage
22.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck visits Jordan to explore the country's rich Biblical history. Renowned Israeli tour guide and archaeologist Danny "The Digger" Herman joins us on the legendary Mount Nebo, where God showed Moses the Promised Land. We also learn the story of the Nabatean people, who were a powerful presence in Jordan, Arabia and southern Israel during the time of Jesus. And we get an up close look at the oldest known mosaic map of the Holy Land.

1.title: Israeli Ambassador Ron Dermer, Ps. John Hagee, and Reporting from Jerusalem
1.plot: One-off drama starring Stephen Graham as a CCTV operator who intervenes in a dangerous world that he's supposed to just be watching, when the police fail to tackle a group of drug dealers Strong language and tense and violent scenes

6.title: Countering Iran's Ballistic Missiles and Inside the Bar Kochba Revolt
6.plot: Featuring: Dani Dayan - Israeli Consul General to NY, Danny "The Digger" Herman - Archaeologist and Tour Guide.

7.title: Avi Dichter on Threats Facing Israel and America
7.plot: Featuring: Avi Dichter - Israel's Foreign Affairs and Defense Committee.

8.title: Rising Anti-Semitism and Why Christians Must Respond
8.plot: Featuring: Pastor Matthew Hagee - Cornerstone Church, Pastor Joey Steelman - CUFI - Lakeview Assembly Church - The Lord's Gym.

9.title: Israel, First Line of Defense for the West
9.plot: Featuring: Brig. Gen. (Res.) Yossi Kupperwasser - Jerusalem Center for Public Affairs, Moti Zaken - Israeli Ministry of Public Security, David Brog - CUFI.

10.title: Unholy Alliance at Israel's Doorstep and Reclaiming Israel's History
10.plot: Featuring: Miri Eisen - Geopolitical Analysis, David Brog - CUFI.

11.title: Fighting Back Against Palestinian Terrorism
11.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck joins Israel's elite volunteer counter-terrorism unit for a patrol of Jerusalem's Old City. Plus, we take an in-depth look at the Palestinian Authority's support for terrorism and author David Brog discusses his latest book, "Reclaiming Israel's History."

12.title: The Biblical Mandate for Christians to Support Israel
12.plot: On this week's episode, we lay out four good reasons why Christians - and all Americans - should support Israel. We also sit down with a courageous Presbyterian pastor who is defying his denomination to stand with Israel. Plus, we head to Ra'anana to see how Israel's largest food bank is blessing the poor and honoring an ancient Biblical tradition. Featuring: Rev. Dr. Kenneth C. Larter - Deerfield Presbyterian Church, Joseph Gitler - Leket Israel.

13.title: Inside Jerusalem's Largest Archaeological Dig
13.plot: On this week's episode of The Watchman, host Erick Stakelbeck tours the City of David for an up-close look at the largest archaeological excavation site in all of Jerusalem: the Givati Parking Lot dig. Featuring: Jamie Elgrod, Tour Guide.

14.title: Part One: Holocaust Survivor Irving Roth Shares His Miraculous Story
14.plot: On this week's episode of The Watchman, host Erick Stakelbeck interviews Holocaust survivor Irving Roth about his miraculous life story and escape from the Nazi regime. Part One of a Two Part Series.

15.title: Part Two: Holocaust Survivor Irving Roth Shares His Miraculous Story
15.plot: On this week's episode of The Watchman, host Erick Stakelbeck interviews Holocaust survivor Irving Roth about his miraculous life story and escape from the Nazi regime. Part Two of a Two Part Series.

16.title: Israel's 1948 War for Independence and the Legendary Burma Road
16.plot: On this week's episode, host Erick Stakelbeck travels to Israel to tour the legendary "Burma Road" bypass that the Israeli military used to help win the 1948 War for Independence. Featuring: Danny "The Digger" Herman - Archeologist and Tour Guide.

17.title: Israeli Leaders Share Why Jerusalem Must Remain Israel's Undivided Capital
17.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem, where he interviews Israel's Deputy Foreign Minister, Tzipi Hotovely, and former head of Shin Bet, Avi Dichter, about the need for Jerusalem to remain the undivided capital of Israel.

18.title: On-The-Ground Analysis of Syria's Civil War, from Israel's Golan Heights
18.plot: On this week's episode, host Erick Stakelbeck is joined by Middle East and intelligence expert Avi Melamed on Israel's Golan Heights, along the Syrian border, to discuss the Syrian Civil War, it's ramifications for America and Israel, and how ISIS, Iran, Hezbollah, Russia and others are taking advantage.

19.title: Israel: First Line of Defense for West Against Radical Islam
19.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to interview Israeli Knesset member Tzachi Hanegbi and security expert Avi Melamed about the threats posed by the likes of Iran, Hezbollah, and Hamas and how Israel and America should respond.

20.title: The Return to Israel's Biblical Heartland
20.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in the Israeli city of Efrat to talk with Mayor Oded Ravivi and founding Rabbi Shlomo Riskin about their city's amazing growth. Plus, Michael Freund, founder of Shavei Israel, joins Erick in Jerusalem to discuss the the modern-day ingathering of the exiles to Israel.

21.title: The Barbarians Are Here; ISIS Terror Strikes the West
21.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Washington, D.C. with Pastor John Hagee to discuss the upcoming CUFI Summit in the nation's capital, which will feature Vice President Mike Pence as keynote speaker. Plus, Dr. Michael Youssef joins Erick to talk about his new book, "The Barbarians Are Here." We also head to Jerusalem to discuss Christian persecution with author and Middle East correspondent Chris Mitchell.

22.title: Incredible Biblical Heritage of Ancient Israeli Port City of Jaffa
22.plot: On this week's episode of The Watchman, host Erick Stakelbeck tours the ancient Israeli port city of Jaffa to discover its incredible Biblical heritage, spanning across the Old and New Testaments--from Jonah to the Apostle Peter and beyond.

23.title: The City of David's Top 10 Finds Proving Israel's Claim to Jerusalem, Pt 1
23.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck tours the City of David in Jerusalem to discover the top ten archaeological finds that prove the ancient Jewish Biblical claim to Jerusalem. Part 1 of 2.

24.title: The City of David's Top 10 Finds Proving Israel's Claim to Jerusalem, Pt 2
24.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck tours the City of David in Jerusalem to discover the top ten archaeological finds that prove the ancient Jewish Biblical claim to Jerusalem. Conclusion: Part 2 of 2.

25.title: Britain's Battle Against ISIS and Anti-Semitism, Pt 1
25.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck travels to London to report on the recent rise of terrorism and anti-semitism in Great Britain.

26.title: Can Christian Zionists Lead Fight Against Rising Anti-Semitism in UK? Pt 2
26.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in London reporting on the rise of terrorism and anti-Semitism in Great Britain and how Christians in the UK are taking a stand for Israel. Part 2 of 2.

27.title: The Dead Sea Scrolls: Who Wrote Them and What They Mean
27.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Israel's Judean desert to discover the history of the legendary Dead Sea Scrolls and their link to John the Baptist.

28.title: France Battles ISIS Terror and Anti-Semitism
28.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck travels to Paris to report on the rise of ISIS terrorism and anti-semitism in France and its impact on the West.

29.title: For Zion's Sake, We Will Not Remain Silent
29.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Washington, D.C. to interview Lt. Col. Allen West about the terrorist threat to America and Israel. Plus, CUFI's annual Washington Summit is recapped, and one woman shares her amazing journey from surviving incredible hardship in Africa to becoming a passionate pro-Israel activist.

30.title: Psagot Winery and the Rebirth of Israel's Ancient Vineyards
30.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck visits Psagot Winery in the mountains of Jerusalem to learn how the vineyards of Israel are coming back to life and fulfilling Bible prophecy.

31.title: From Jerusalem with Governor Mike Huckabee
31.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is joined in Jerusalem by former Arkansas Governor Mike Huckabee to discuss why Israel should matter to every Christian. Plus, the "Vicar of Baghdad" shares his firsthand account of Christian persecution in the Middle East.

32.title: Ambassador David Friedman on Growing Strength of U.S./Israel Alliance
32.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck sits down with the U.S. Ambassador to Israel, David Friedman, at his residence in Herziliya to discuss strengthening U.S./Israel relations, Jerusalem, Iran and more. Plus, the harrowing story of the forgotten Jewish refugees of the Middle East is recounted.

33.title: Hezbollah Rising, From Israeli/Lebanon Border
33.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck travels to the Israeli/Lebanon border with Middle East expert Avi Melamed for an up-close look at the threat posed to Israel and America by the Iran-backed terrorist militia Hezbollah.

34.title: Israel's Rebirth and the Christian Zionist Calling
34.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in London to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the legendary Balfour Declaration. Plus, the amazing and unlikely story of a group of 19th century American Christians who founded a colony in the Israeli port city of Jaffa.

35.title: Iran Deal On the Ropes, Israel Gaining New Allies Worldwide
35.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to interview Israeli Knesset member Michael Oren about the flawed Iran nuclear deal and Israel's new alliances around the world.

36.title: The Ancient Ruins of Lachish, Site of Major Old Testament Battle
36.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Israel to explore the ruins of the ancient city of Lachish, destroyed by the Assyrians during Old Testament times. Plus, a visit to the Israel museum in Jerusalem.

37.title: How the Palestinian Authority Promotes Hatred and Violence Against Israel
37.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to interview Itamar Marcus, Director of Palestinian Media Watch, who exposes the Palestinian Authority's campaign of hatred and incitement against Israel.

38.title: Israeli Archaeologists Uncover Jerusalem's Road of Pilgrimage from Time of Jesus
38.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to visit an active archaeological dig where the ancient Pilgrimage Road from the time of Jesus is being uncovered.

39.title: Napoleon, Crusaders and More; Fascinating History of Akko, Ancient Israeli Port City
39.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck visits the ancient Israeli port city of Akko (Acre) to learn its amazing history, from the Old Testament to the Crusaders to Napoleon to today.

40.title: Israeli Archaeologists Uncovering Babylonian Destruction of Jerusalem
40.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Jerusalem to see new archaeological evidence of the Babylonian destruction of the city 2600 years ago. Plus, a fascinating tour of the ancient Old Testament fortress of Tel Arad.

41.title: The Middle East Cold War is Heating Up
41.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is joined in San Antonio by Pastor John Hagee to discuss the growth of Christians United for Israel, the U.S. Embassy moving to Jerusalem, and what's next in the Middle East. Plus, an in-depth look at the growing pro-Israel movement among Hispanic evangelicals.

42.title: How Israeli Doctors are Changing the Landscape of Medicine
42.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck is in Ramat Gan to see the amazing breakthroughs of Sheba Medical Center, the largest medical center in Israel.

43.title: The Year in Review, 2017
43.plot: Host Erick Stakelbeck looks back at the events that impacted America, Israel, and the world in 2017 and looks ahead to what's coming in the Middle East in 2018.

imdb.title: The Watchman
plot: America's largest pro-Israel organization joins forces with the world's largest Christian television network to produce "_The Watchman_ (qv)," a hard-hitting weekly 30-minute program, hosted by CUFI's Erick Stakelbeck on TBN.::_The Watchman_ (qv)
